questions.question: The woman broke ……………………… in the middle of her speech.
Please blow ……………………….. the candle.
questions.description: To blow out is to extinguish.

questions.question: At last the storm has blown …………………………
The opposition parties are planning to bring ………………………… a No-Confidence Motion against the Prime Minister.
questions.description: To bring something forward is to introduce it for discussion.

questions.question: The accused said that he couldn't call …………………………. the whole events.
questions.description: To call something up is to recollect it.

questions.question: The workers have called …………………….. the strike.
questions.description: To call off something is to cancel it.

questions.question: The investigators tried to call ………………………….. crucial information from him.
questions.description: To call forth is to elicit.

questions.question: The terrorist’s plan to blow ………………………… the bridge was foiled by police.
She is cut ……………………… for a job of this kind.
questions.description: When you are cut out for something, you are perfectly suitable for it.

questions.question: If you work hard you will come …………………………. with flying colours.
questions.description: To come off with flying colours is to be triumphant.

questions.question: The publishers are bringing ……………………….. a new edition of this book.
questions.description: To bring out is to publish.

questions.question: The scheme fell ………………………….. for want of support.
